title.narrative: Catalyzing system change for post-consumer textile recycling

description.narrative: This project promotes The Netherlands’ Child Labour Due Diligence law, in collaboration with two big companies in India Jindal, Naath, the NGO HPP India, the company HPP Baltic, Consultancy company FFact and Sympany. We aim to root out child labour in the post-consumer textile recycling value chain through supply chain mapping and inspections down to supply and trading businesses, and create prevention programmes that makes education available to the children linked to this value chain. This will demonstrate our assessment framework as standard to address child labour beyond tier one and recycling textile resources for new garments again.2019 Researches and analyses of the Sympany value chain teach us that about 1 million kg (approximately four and a half percent of total) of the collected and sorted post-consumer textile of Sympany arrives via trading partners in India annually. Most possibly further processed in Panipat.In FBK1 we have traced this part of the textile value chain, as a picture in time.Through connecting links of the textile recycling value chain: from collecting post-consumer textiles to the production of new textiles we want to reach the goal to make the post-consumer collected textile profitable, proven child labour free and mitigating the mountain of low value textile at the same time. Our aim is to address this by feasibility studies for technical solutions to process post-consumer un-wearable textile into high quality yarn. This yarn is used for producing garments and other quality products.
